result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter R. Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may terminate after 2 years with Agent consent and if there have been no rule violations.

miscConds.notes:
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim J.M.
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees. 
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty hours of community service work per year of probation ordered to a total of one hundred twenty (120) hours WITHOUT buyout option.

Defendant Peter R. Murphy in court, in custody with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Not guilty pleas entered
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Status conference at 03-11-2016 01:15 pm

3:30 pm  Defendant Peter R. Murphy in court, in custody with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:30 pm  Attorney Grotelueschen advises Court that defendant will be waiving right to preliminary hearing.
3:30 pm  Court has colloquy with defendant.  Court finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to preliminary hearing and binds defendant over for trial.
3:31 pm  Attorney Grotelueschen acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts continued in Information.
3:31 pm  Speedy Trial Demand made.
3:32 pm  Not Guilty pleas have been entered on companion files and Speedy Demand made on those files as well.
3:35 pm  Court in recess.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Peter R. Murphy in court, in custody with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 16GF121, 15CM564, 15CM481 & 15CM593
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M. OR HER RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
